title: Counter
notes: Simple solution for simple task. Just used signal to store counter value and signal.update() to update it.
Signals do not change much in this case.

title: Temperature converter
notes: Initially I wanted to do it using computed() signals. That was a bad idea: while technically working, it changed only values in the template. Actual component values was untouched and it caused a lot of confusion.
After that I moved to basic solution with regular writable signals and separate methods to update Celsius and Fahrenheit values.

title: Flight booker
notes: Good example of computed() signals usage. Instead of adding logic to check valid dates and one-way/return flights in the template, we're creating computed signals.

This way we can keep template clear. It's still doable with pipes and methods, but usage of methods in the template should be avoided, and pipes is not such a good idea if we're not going to reuse it in other components.
